DataElement.preferredName: Core Biopsy Specimen Formaldehyde Fixative Submitted Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time the submitted tissue samples, removed using a needle with a relatively large diameter, being preserved using 10% formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde, a colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol in water and used as a histologic fixative and used to preserve biological specimens.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Core Biopsy Specimen Formaldehyde Fixative Submitted
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a submitted tissue sample, removed using a needle with a relatively large diameter,  being preserved using 10% formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde, a colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol in water and used as a histologic fixative, and used to preserve biological specimens.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04):Agents employed in the preparation of histologic or pathologic specimens for the purpose of maintaining the existing form and structure of all of the constituent elements.:Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
